body: Hello Guys, I was wondering if somebody could help me with a simple question, I have been trying to analyse the daylight in a public space during the whole year. There is any way to have an average day using that period? So the range of my table is going to be in a daily basis showing between 0 and 8 hrs instead of from 0 to 92 hrs. Many thanks and congrats for this awesome tool! **Nico** [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/4hNukqhfhE1uVNiDXBGkV4lOvHsd*qnf0G3A8cWojgdo946OohGX6ygjxpCVpbRWMB0GE-jMZcNofBXhuTkTW5t2lSrge64y/2b.jpg)
topic: Daylight Average for One day in a whole year period.

replies.body: Hi Nico, I'm not sure if I understand your question right but if you mean how can you run it for every day and then average them you can use branching. It will take longer though. Here is an example. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/4Ejr0qlHpqL1ciJ*vX5w7La6imC1BIRO6OA1SG-1MH-09r9JvTRlMHIOo*7CTLVK68Y*S*CIekdn4tF3stdek0BnAx7E2LrW/averageDailySunlightHours.png) Mostapha

Hello Mostapha,

Thank you for your answer. If the result that you posted is showing the average for 1 day, across the whole year is exactly what I need. I will try it in the definition that I am working on and I'll let you know.



Many thanks.

Nico.
